prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.4687, 0.0] For the sketch, create a rectangle on face_1 with the following loop: * line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] * line_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.2812, 0.5625] * line_3: [0.2812, 0.5625] to [0.0, 0.5625] * line_4: [0.0, 0.5625] to [0.0, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.4687 units. This will create the desired rectangular prism. Part 2: Three-dimensional geometric shape with a triangular base and a rectangular top Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a triangular base and a rectangular top, connected by a straight line. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.75, 0.4687, 0.0] For the sketch, create a right triangle on face_1 with the following loop: * line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.2344, 0.2812] * line_2: [0.2344, 0.2812] to [0.0, 0.2812] * line_3: [0.0, 0.2812] to [0.0, 0.0] Do not extrude this sketch along the normal vector. Instead, extrude it in the opposite direction along the normal vector by 0.2812 units. This will create the desired shape, with the triangular base located at the top and the rectangular top located at the bottom. The height, width, and length of part 1 are approximately 0.75, 0.4687, and 0.75 units, respectively. The height, width, and length of part 2 are approximately 0.2812, 0.2812, and 0.2812 units, respectively. The final shape has a rectangular cross-section, with a rectangular base and a triangular top connected by a rectangular body.</description>
